sentences: John Wort Hannam is a Canadian folk musician, from Fort Macleod, Alberta.
He is known for his story telling through music.
Themes which are central to his music include life in Western Canada, and the human experience as seen through the eyes of working folk.
Hannam was born in Jersey, Channel Islands.
Hannam was a full-time public school teacher until 2000.
He has performed at festivals in Canada, the United States, Great Britain and Australia and he appeared at the 2006 Smithsonian Folklife Festival in Washington, D.C..
In addition to singing, John plays guitar, tenor guitar and harmonica.
In 2010 Hannam as presented with a Canadian Folk Music Award.
2007 New Folk Winner Kerrville Folk Festival
2007 Songwriting Competition Calgary Folk Music Festival
2006 Best Performance Calgary Folk Music Festival
2005 CBC Galaxie Rising Star Award Edmonton Folk Music Festival
2004 Songwriting Competition Calgary Folk Music Festival
Released on independent label Black Hen Music
Released on independent label Black Hen Music
